security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing static documentation and YAML/PromQL templates for service mesh observability. No code execution paths, no credential access, no file system or network operations. The content matches the stated purpose exactly.

content.user_title: Set up service mesh observability fast
content.value_statement: Service mesh telemetry is hard to wire across traces, metrics, and dashboards. This skill provides ready templates and queries for Istio and Linkerd observability.
actual_capabilities: Provides Prometheus scrape and ServiceMonitor templates for Istio mesh metrics.
Supplies PromQL queries for request rate, error rate, and latency by service.
Includes Jaeger deployment and Istio tracing configuration with sampling settings.
Lists Linkerd viz install commands for dashboard and traffic inspection.
Offers Kiali configuration for mesh topology visualization.
Defines OpenTelemetry Collector and Istio Telemetry v2 settings.
limitations: Does not deploy resources or run commands automatically.
Covers Istio and Linkerd examples only.
Does not validate your cluster configuration or alert thresholds.
No guidance for vendor-specific hosted observability platforms.

use_cases.title: Stand up mesh monitoring
use_cases.description: Use templates to wire Prometheus, Grafana, and tracing for a new service mesh.

use_cases.title: Investigate latency spikes
use_cases.description: Apply PromQL queries and tracing setup to locate high latency services.

use_cases.title: Define mesh SLOs
use_cases.description: Use golden signal guidance to frame SLOs and alert rules for services.

prompt_templates.title: Quick start
prompt_templates.prompt: List the minimal steps and templates to enable Istio metrics and tracing in a new cluster.

prompt_templates.title: Dashboards
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide the key PromQL queries for request rate, error rate, and P99 latency by service.

prompt_templates.title: Tracing rollout
prompt_templates.prompt: Give an IstioOperator and Jaeger deployment example for distributed tracing.

prompt_templates.title: Full stack
prompt_templates.prompt: Combine Prometheus, Grafana, Jaeger, Kiali, and OTel templates into a staged rollout plan.

output_examples.input: Give me a concise checklist to enable Istio observability with Prometheus and Jaeger.
output: Deploy Prometheus with the Istio scrape config and ServiceMonitor.
Enable tracing in Istio and point Zipkin to Jaeger collector.
Install Jaeger all-in-one and expose the UI port.
Add PromQL panels for request rate, errors, and P99 latency.

best_practices: Sample tracing at high rates in dev and lower in production to control costs.
Use consistent trace context propagation across all services.
Alert on golden signals with clear thresholds defined in PrometheusRule.
anti_patterns: Collecting high cardinality labels without limits on Prometheus.
Running 100 percent tracing in production by default.
Operating without dashboards for service dependencies and topology.

faq.question: Is this compatible with Istio and Linkerd?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides examples for both Istio and Linkerd observability workflows.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides templates and guidance only. It does not deploy or validate configurations.

faq.question: Can I integrate with OpenTelemetry?
faq.answer: Yes, it includes an OpenTelemetry Collector config and Istio Telemetry example.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No, it contains static documentation and does not access files or environment data.

faq.question: What if my metrics are missing?
faq.answer: Verify Prometheus scrape targets, service labels, and Istio telemetry settings are correct.

faq.question: How does it compare to vendor tools?
faq.answer: It is vendor neutral and uses common open source components and queries.
